An intern encrypted the flag with RSA, but accidentally generated both primes as Blum integers. Can you recover the flag? Ciphertext: 6319741862231478703474790188962035448604868893635850221707398094477465554020107887451777852378140427508845071230778564617502793003907611449005369195738020

The flag format is flag{...}
n=11830636492846491482245635940509771904503794395019689913708731732294225257564764156026604414767218724247103389880442042286515445150397594742616259973932473, e=3572540960440732016383030472404119499031639397478720140474941725906135993131642757819439150952516241815389226828096596683871567468543717124766809783296545
The lower 104 bits of p are: 50507256141121882499104703762517317291


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{79l3r8oi}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 6319741862231478703474790188962035448604868893635850221707398094477465554020107887451777852378140427508845071230778564617502793003907611449005369195738020
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=11830636492846491482245635940509771904503794395019689913708731732294225257564764156026604414767218724247103389880442042286515445150397594742616259973932473, e=3572540960440732016383030472404119499031639397478720140474941725906135993131642757819439150952516241815389226828096596683871567468543717124766809783296545
The lower 104 bits of p are: 50507256141121882499104703762517317291

extra_info: p=103461720733675972844959407199586851810848714551501563668764650066597305243307, q=114347957959254323083505680026215425462064465837599112559338522180112920970539, Ï†(n)=11830636492846491482245635940509771904503794395019689913708731732294225257564546346347911484471290259159877587603169129106126344474169491570369549747718628
